subject: Clarification regarding applicability of GST on payment of Annuity under BOT projects completed before implementation of GST on 01.07.2017- reg.
text: HR <ety TTTHRf gfetarrut RH14 / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (us* War7 3){TTHTf HAT4) Y47 Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 7f-5 U 6, #2r-10, #Ra, T ferit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/GST/2021 Policy No. 3.3.23/2021 dated 24th November 2021 {Decision taken on E-Office File No_ NHAI/FGA/GST-2021-22/SM-Vol IV (Comp.No.1 114969)} Sub.: Clarification  regarding  applicability of GST on payment of  Annuity under BOT projects completed before implementation of GST on 01.07.2017- reg; Ref: 1) NHAI Circular No.3,3.17 dated 23.10.2017 (copy enclosed) 2) CBIC Notification No.33/2017 dated 13.10.2017 3) CBIC clarification Circular No.150/06/2021-GST dated 17.06.2021 (copy enclosed) Please refer to NHAI's circular No. 3.3.17 dated 23.10.2017 (Ref.1)   regarding applicability of GST on annuity Pavments and subsequent clarifications issued by CBIC, DoR; MoF vide its circular dated 17.06.2021 (Ref.3) . In this regard, the following is further clarified regarding applicability of GST_on Annuity payments under BOT (Annuity) Projects completed prior to implementation of GST on 01.07.2017 and/or annuity payable on or after 01c07207 (i) Asper the_recommendations of 43rd GST Council meeting held on 28.05.2021 CBIC has already clarified the availability %f exemptions on the payment of toll or annuity' for access to road or bridge, under para-2.1 vide circular No. 150/06/2021 GST dated 17.06.2021 _ which is reproduced below: "Together the entries 23 and 23A exempt access to road or bridge , whether the consideration are in the form of toll or annuity [heading 9967]" (ii) Notification No.33/2017-Integrated tax (rate), dated 13.10.2017 was issued CBIC and its provisions shall remain applicable for BOT (Annuity) projects, inter alia Service by Way %f access to @ road or a bridge on payment of annuity applicable GST is Nil (Sl. No. Heading 9967) . (iii) Further; CBIC has also clarified to MoRTH on the nature of activity and of GST under BOT and HAM model, which is reproduced below: "Reference to BOT and HAM models, it is to mention that the two models are not comparable in so far as the nature of activity for the purpose of of GST is concerned. Annuity in BOT model was exempted only for a reason that tolls were already from GST, thus the same treatment to the toll and annuity in lieu of toll exempt 2_ In view of above and in accordance with NHAI's Policy Circular No_ 3.3.17 dated 23.10.2017, no GST is applicable on Annuity Payments in case of BOT (Annuity) Projects.
